TITLE: Can Paramount Compete With Netflix and Disney?
SUMMARY: The dominance of Netflix and Disney in streaming has forced many companies to join forces. So far, Paramount has gone its own way.

TITLE: Inside the Apple Store Battle for Union Representation
SUMMARY: Weary from the pandemic and pressured by inflation, retail employees of the tech giant are holding votes on whether to unionize.

TITLE: Times Square at Its Overcrowded, Dizzying Worst Is Exactly What N.Y.C. Needs
SUMMARY: The economic future of New York depends on everyone coming back, not just the tourists. Too bad office workers don’t want to join them.

TITLE: The Week in Business: Escalating U.S. Sanctions on Russia
SUMMARY: The chip maker Broadcom continued its acquisitive streak, buying VMware. Gas prices head higher. And a report will show if job growth continues to be strong.

TITLE: ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ Lands Triumphantly on Opening Weekend
SUMMARY: The film industry takes the estimated $151 million in North American ticket sales as a breakthrough after a long pandemic slump.

TITLE: Illegal Immigration Is Down, Changing the Face of California Farms
SUMMARY: Farmers are turning to workers on seasonal visas and mechanizing what they can. Many labor-intensive crops are shifting south of the border.

TITLE: Gun in Texas Shooting Came From Company Known for Pushing Boundaries
SUMMARY: Daniel Defense, which makes military-style rifles, was an early adopter of direct-to-consumer marketing and has a history of running provocative ads.

TITLE: How a 7,000-Ton Broadway Theater Was Hoisted 30 Feet
SUMMARY: The Beaux-Arts interior of the Palace Theater is a protected landmark, so developers had to devise a plan to raise it three stories in their effort to add more retail space.

TITLE: The Texas Law That Has Banks Saying They Don’t ‘Discriminate’ Against Guns
SUMMARY: Recent legislation requires firms to declare that they don’t “discriminate” against the firearm industry — or risk losing lucrative business with the state.

TITLE: Activist Investing Has Come for Fossil Fuels. What About Guns?
SUMMARY: With politicians unwilling to act, some investors are trying to use shareholder resolutions to get gun makers to rein in their products.

TITLE: Woman Gets 15 Months in Prison for Punching Flight Attendant in the Face
SUMMARY: Prosecutors said Vyvianna M. Quinonez, 29, of Sacramento, will also have to pay nearly $26,000 in restitution and a $7,500 fine for the May 2021 attack, which was widely viewed online.

TITLE: How Some People Travel to the U.S. After Positive Covid Tests
SUMMARY: Entering the United States by air requires a negative coronavirus test. Some people who can’t provide one are using a workaround: flying to Canada or Mexico, then entering via a land border.

TITLE: Ron Rice, Creator of Hawaiian Tropic Lotion, Is Dead at 81
SUMMARY: A poor, pale mountain boy who became smitten with the beach, he mixed some ingredients in a garbage can and found his place in the sun.

TITLE: Eric Adams Meets With NYC Business Leaders About Subway Safety
SUMMARY: In his quest to get more workers back to the city, the mayor tried to reassure employers that he was taking steps to address crime, especially on the subways.

TITLE: Trump’s Lawsuit Against Letitia James Is Dismissed
SUMMARY: Mr. Trump had argued that an inquiry by the attorney general, Letitia James, violated his constitutional rights. It was his second legal loss in two days.

TITLE: At Taco Bell, the Drag Brunch Goes Corporate
SUMMARY: The glittery live shows have long been a staple in many cities, but the fast-food chain is taking that a step further.

TITLE: Goldman’s Move to Unlimited Vacation Is Good for … Goldman
SUMMARY: Goldman Sachs is the latest company to let workers take as much time off as they want. That means no more unused days — and no need to pay them out later.

TITLE: Gas Prices Hit New Highs as Summer Driving Season Starts
SUMMARY: A gallon has jumped by about 50 cents over the last month as Russia’s war in Ukraine has continued to unsettle the global energy market.

TITLE: As Inflation Bites, Personal Income Stayed Strong
SUMMARY: A government measure of disposable income rose 0.3 percent last month, but was flat when rising prices are taken into account.

TITLE: A Strong Summer Job Market for Teenagers
SUMMARY: Economists are predicting the highest rate of employment in 15 years. “Employers suddenly rediscovered teenagers,” one said.

TITLE: Is the Stock Market a Shy Bear, or Will It Become a Monster?
SUMMARY: The decline has been unnerving, but readers want to know how nasty this year’s downturn may become. Our columnist turns to history for answers.

TITLE: What Dominated the World Economic Forum
SUMMARY: Our takeaways from Davos, plus how some influencers hype crypto without disclosing their financial ties.

TITLE: Americans Keep Spending Even as Inflation Erodes Buying Power
SUMMARY: To keep up with rising prices, Americans are saving less, but economists expect expenditures to slow in the months ahead.

TITLE: Stock Market Set to Snap Long Losing Streak
SUMMARY: Investors this week put more money into stocks than they have in months, as markets regained some lost ground.

TITLE: Housing Market Has Altered the Math of Moving
SUMMARY: The housing market has altered the math of moving for nearly everyone.

TITLE: Global Brands Seek Clarity on Xinjiang
SUMMARY: Companies that sourced cotton from the region in China are weighing evidence of forced labor, a lack of visibility into operations and new regulation.

TITLE: How Influencers Hype Crypto, Without Disclosing Their Financial Ties
SUMMARY: Logan Paul, Paul Pierce and other celebrities have promoted risky and obscure digital currencies, sometimes failing to mention their conflicts of interest.

TITLE: TikTok’s Amber Heard Hate Machine
SUMMARY: Television turned the celebrity trial into a 24-hour tabloid spectacle. Social media made it into a sport.

TITLE: Former Head of Louvre Is Charged in Artifact Trafficking Case
SUMMARY: Jean-Luc Martinez, who led the museum from 2013 to 2021, was charged with complicity in fraud and money laundering in an investigation into the trafficking of Egyptian antiquities.

TITLE: Daniel Defense Got $3.1 Million in Pandemic Aid
SUMMARY: Daniel Defense was one of nearly 500 gun and ammunition makers and retailers that collected a total of $125 million from the Paycheck Protection Program.

TITLE: Substack Drops Fund-Raising Efforts as Market Sours
SUMMARY: Amid an industrywide downturn, venture investors are preaching austerity and halting new deals, particularly for companies that have spent aggressively on growth.

TITLE: White House Aims to Increase Regulation and Competition in Poultry Industry
SUMMARY: More than 90 percent of chickens eaten by Americans are raised by farmers under contracts with poultry processing companies.

TITLE: Imaging Contrast Dye Shortage Delays Tests for Diseases
SUMMARY: Many U.S. hospitals are postponing scans used to diagnose diseases after a Covid lockdown in China hobbled the main U.S. supplier of an imaging chemical.

TITLE: Colin Forbes, a ‘Designer’s Designer,’ Is Dead at 94
SUMMARY: He was best known as the brain behind Pentagram, the influential partnership that has been a force in the design world for half a century.

TITLE: Southwest and JetBlue Expect Higher Second-Quarter Revenues as Travel Booms
SUMMARY: Ticket sales are climbing faster than the airline industry expected as more people plan summer vacations and business trips.

TITLE: Icahn’s Loses Clash With McDonald’s Over Pig Welfare
SUMMARY: The activist investor had nominated two directors to the company’s board as part of an animal welfare campaign.

TITLE: Macy’s, Dollar General and Dollar Tree Shares Soar After Earnings Reports
SUMMARY: Macy’s, Dollar General and Dollar Tree bucked a trend of retailers struggling to overcome inflationary pressures.

TITLE: U.K. Announces Windfall Tax on Oil and Gas Profits
SUMMARY: The tax on the “extraordinary” profits of oil and gas companies is expected to raise 5 billion pounds and help fund £15 billion in payments to households.

TITLE: With VMware deal, Broadcom reaches for the cloud
SUMMARY: The $61 billion combination is one of the biggest of the year, and may signal more tech deals to come.

TITLE: Are Defenders the New Monteros? If So, What’s Next?
SUMMARY: Buyers have been turning to cheaper substitutes and finding, to their surprise, that some are the equal of the more established collectible.

TITLE: Bus Maker Settles Fraud Case Tied to Government Contract
SUMMARY: The company, New Flyer, a supplier to Los Angeles County, was accused of not fulfilling a commitment to create jobs that paid agreed-upon wages and benefits.

TITLE: Where the Ice Cream Cones at Dairy Queen and Mister Softee Come From
SUMMARY: Joy Baking Group has cornered much of the market with one guiding principle: When it comes to cones, people want what they know.

TITLE: South Korean Workers Turn the Tables on Their Bad Bosses
SUMMARY: “South Koreans live with an enormous tolerance for abuse” from the powerful, said one famously bullied advocate. A backlash has erupted.

TITLE: Gen Zers Are Buying Homes. Here’s Where They’re Looking.
SUMMARY: Priced out of large metro areas, many young adults are seeking mortgages in midsize cities, new research shows.

TITLE: Russia Cuts Rates as Ruble Hits Multiyear High
SUMMARY: The Russian central bank is seeking to support an economy hurt by inflation and sanctions.

TITLE: Twitter Fined in Privacy Settlement, as Musk Commits More Equity for Deal
SUMMARY: Twitter did not do enough to tell its users that the personal data it had collected was used partly to help marketers target ads, the F.T.C. and Justice Department said.

TITLE: Bolt Starts Layoffs Amid ‘Structural Changes’
SUMMARY: The Silicon Valley company cut jobs on Wednesday amid a souring fund-raising environment for start-ups.

TITLE: E. Gerald Corrigan, Who Helped Ease ’87 Stock Crash, Dies at 80
SUMMARY: As president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, he favored flooding the financial system with cash to restore confidence among investors.

TITLE: F.D.A. Chief Details ‘Shocking’ Conditions at Baby Formula Plant
SUMMARY: Agency inspectors found a leaking roof, standing water and cracked production equipment before a facility shutdown that led to major shortages.

TITLE: Fed Minutes Show Officials Expecting to Raise Rates Three Times to Address Inflation
SUMMARY: Minutes of the Federal Reserve’s May meeting underscored the deep concern within the central bank about rapidly rising prices that have far exceeded the Fed’s target.

TITLE: U.S. Budget Deficit Is Projected to Fall to $1 Trillion in 2022
SUMMARY: The Congressional Budget Office provided an update on the path for deficits at a moment when the Federal Reserve is trying to cool the economy to tame rapid inflation.

TITLE: Thomas S. Murphy, Broadcasting ‘Minnow’ Who Swallowed ABC, Dies at 96
SUMMARY: As the head of Capital Cities Communications, he engineered the acquisition of the TV giant. He later sold the company to Disney, at a huge profit.

TITLE: Twitter’s Chief Tries Staying the Course as Elon Musk Upends Plans
SUMMARY: Parag Agrawal, Twitter’s chief executive, is grappling with a takeover where nobody “would want to be in those shoes.”

TITLE: ‘Quantum Internet’ Inches Closer With Advance in Data Teleportation
SUMMARY: Scientists have improved their ability to send quantum information across distant computers — and have taken another step toward the network of the future.

TITLE: China Pushes for Regular Mass Virus Testing
SUMMARY: The strategy risks increasing economic stress and trying people’s patience.

TITLE: Guns, Law and the Uvalde Elementary School Shooting
SUMMARY: This could be the mass shooting that leads to significant change — or it could join the long list of other atrocities that have been followed by policy stalemates.

TITLE: Gun Stocks Are Muted in Early Trading
SUMMARY: After shootings, investors often anticipate appeals for tighter gun laws and an increase in sales.

TITLE: Germany plans to keep coal-fired plants ready in case Russian gas is cut.
SUMMARY: The power plants, due to be shut down, would be kept in reserve to provide electricity if Russia ended shipments of natural gas.

TITLE: 7 Million Bad Student Loans With No Way Out, for Anyone
SUMMARY: The Biden administration plans to offer those with loans in default a fresh start. It would help borrowers and the government alike.
